overview:
Tony DeNiro (birth name Anthony D. Smith) is a former professional football player (Notre Dame, Kansas City Chiefs), an American record producer and Internet/Social Media executive.

Tony has produced pop, rock, hip-hop and R&B music. Known for discovering, producing and branding artists such Mark Wahlberg, Missy Elliott, Usher, Fonzworth Bentley, Blu Cantrell and Terrence Howard. He is also acknowledged for consulting career artists such as Brandy, Heavy D, Ben Harper, Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs, Jessica Simpson, Ashlee Simpson, Shwayze, Lindsay Lohan, Aaron Carter and Evan Ross.

Mr. DeNiro was formerly Sr VP at Priority Records but later decided to launch his own company and secured production deals with both Capitol Records and Universal Records.

Having always been an early adaptor to new technology and social media, DeNiro was one of the first users on MySpace, growing fond of the social media space from start. Since 2004, Mr. DeNiro has been a consulting force to several IT companies looking to transition to media conglomerates. Tony has supported social media start-ups for many years and is regarded as a friend to many.

As of late 2012, Mr. DeNiro is the Chief Cultural Officer at Pheed.com, a new social media platform soft-launched on August 10, 2012.

milestones.description: Joined Pheed as Chief Cultural Officer
